p: SEM is an electron microscopy technique that gives the speed and high resolution of a direct surface image besides measuring the dimensions (size and shape) at micro- and nanoscales [ 168, 169, 170]. SEM employs a high beam of energetic electrons, which are focused onto the surface of NP specimens and go through a scattering process; observed signals from these scattered electrons provide the final characteristics of the materials [ 160]. It has been noted that SEM can investigate exterior structure; besides, it can provide worthy information regarding the particle aggregation degree and purity [ 171].
